description: Lists the CMAT (Contact Model Assignment Table). Displays all current entries in the CMAT including their indices, models, properties, and range specifications. This is useful for reviewing the current contact model assignment rules and debugging CMAT configuration. By default, only mechanical contacts are considered.

keywords.name: thermal
keywords.description: List thermal CMAT entries (instead of mechanical)

examples.description: List all mechanical CMAT entries with their indices, models, and properties
Explicitly list mechanical CMAT entries (same as default)

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('contact cmat list') - Python SDK does not provide direct CMAT API, must use command interface. Output goes to console, cannot be captured directly in Python.

output_format.description: The command outputs a formatted table showing CMAT entries
typical_columns: Index - CMAT entry index number (0 is default entry)
Model - Contact model name (linear, linearpbond, etc.)
Properties - List of property names and values
Range - Range specification for this entry
Methods - Any registered methods (e.g., deformability, bond)
notes: Entry index 0 is the default entry
Entries are listed in order (lower indices checked first)
Output format may vary depending on PFC version
Lists all CMAT entries including the default entry (index 0)
CMAT entries are evaluated in the order they appear (lower indices first)
Output is sent to the console and cannot be captured in Python variables
Useful for debugging and reviewing CMAT configuration
Mechanical contacts are listed by default; use 'thermal' keyword for thermal CMAT
Shows which models and properties will be assigned to new contacts
Entry ranges show the conditions under which each entry is applied

common_use_cases.description: Check what contact models and properties are configured before creating contacts
Verify entry indices and order to ensure correct priority (lower indices checked first)
Check entry 0 to see the default/fallback contact model configuration

common_use_cases.command:
contact cmat list mechanical
contact cmat list thermal
common_use_cases.description: List both mechanical and thermal CMAT entries to compare configurations

typical_workflow: 1. Configure CMAT entries using 'contact cmat add' and 'contact cmat default'
2. Use 'contact cmat list' to review the configuration
3. Verify entry order and ranges are correct
4. Check that default entry (index 0) has appropriate fallback model
5. Create contacts - they will be assigned according to CMAT rules
6. If unexpected behavior, use 'contact cmat list' again to debug

interpreting_output.entry_index: Lower indices are checked first when contacts are created. Entry 0 is the default/fallback.
interpreting_output.model_name: The contact model that will be assigned (e.g., linear, linearpbond, hertz)
interpreting_output.properties: Property values that will be set when the model is assigned
interpreting_output.range: Conditions that must be met for this entry to apply (e.g., 'group soil', 'type ball-ball')
interpreting_output.methods: Methods that will be invoked at contact creation (e.g., 'deformability emod=1e9', 'bond')
interpreting_output.inheritance: Whether properties can inherit from contacting pieces

troubleshooting.solution: Use 'contact cmat list' to verify CMAT configuration. Check entry order - specific rules should have lower indices than general rules.

troubleshooting.issue: Don't know which entry is being used
troubleshooting.solution: List CMAT entries and compare ranges with your contact selection. Lower index entries are checked first.
Use 'contact cmat list' to check entry 0. Use 'contact cmat default' to modify it.
